intro: Sida goniocarpa, commonly known as the hairy sida, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves with a rough texture. Its small, yellow flowers are typically clustered in dense inflorescences. Sida goniocarpa is often found in disturbed habitats and is adapted to thrive in dry, sunny environments.
